item.title: Ticket #385 (rss feeds are broken with WP 1.3alpha and permalinks on) created
item.dc:creator: jamesvl
item.description:
On sites with WP 1.3alpha, I noticed the RSS feeds were not working. Though the XML file was being sent with the basic meta info, no story summaries were being sent.

Similar to bug #0000330, this is probably a result of the %category% tag being a permalink option in 1.3. I have not tested this theory, though.

The problem turned out to be one of the later rules written to my .htaccess file. When the line:

RewriteRule ([0-9]{4})/([0-9]{1,2})/([/]+)/(feed|rdf|rss|rss2|atom)/?$ /index.php?year=$1&monthnum=$2&name=$3&feed=$4 [QSA]

caused the problem. Removing it or converting it to

RewriteRule ([a-zA-Z0-9_-]{1,})/(feed|rdf|rss|rss2|atom)/?$ /index.php?category_name=$1&feed=$2 [QSA]

fixed the rss feeds to work as expected.

My guess is that the incorrect RewriteRule was getting picked up even when it shoudln't. As a result, WP was processing a string like

/index.php?category_name=feed&feed=rss2

instead of doing

/index.php?feed=_rss2

item.title: Ticket #383 (WordPress should check whether PHP MySQL extension is installed) updated
item.dc:creator: anonymousbugger
item.description: "stops" should read "causes" in the description.

item.title: Ticket #383 (WordPress should check whether PHP MySQL extension is installed) created
item.dc:creator: anonymousbugger
item.description:
The following code is from wp-includes/wpdb.php $this->dbh = @mysql_connect($dbhost,$dbuser,$dbpassword);

If the MySQL extension for PHP is not installed (mysql_connect function is not defined), then the above line stops PHP to bail out, resulting in just a blank page with no error messages whatsoever.

You can see that behaviour yourself if you change @mysql_connect to @nosql_connect.

item.title: Ticket #381 (user_can_create_draft undefined in 2004-10-16 nightly.) created
item.dc:creator: nickromney
item.description:
Fatal error: Call to undefined function: user_can_create_draft() in C:\Apache2\Apache2\htdocs\wordpress\wp-admin\post.php on line 692

user_can_create_draft() is defined in wp-includes/functions-post.php

Adding the following line to wp-settings.php resolves the error:

require (ABSPATH . WPINC . '/functions-post.php');

item.title: Ticket #380 (Mark all for delete (instead of "delete all marked for defer")) created
item.dc:creator: Jenn99
item.description:
I noticed that there is now a checkbox that says "delete all comments that are marked as defer"

I had come up with a hack for 1.2 that set all the radio boxes to delete: ​http://www.scriptygoddess.com/archives/2004/06/30/comment-moderation-select-all-for-delete/ I assume that what is currently in 1.3 is a take off on that idea, but (not trying to be obnoxious) I think my way of doing it is better, and this is why:

My way: -allows you to STILL "defer" some comments. -Clearly indicates WHICH comments will be deleted - and WHICH will not. ie. you can click that "mark all for delete" and then go back in and select some back to "defer" etc. - and what is marked for DELETE will be DELETED. what is marked for DEFER will be DEFERED

current 1.3 way: -forces you to either approve or delete all comments currently in moderation. (no option to leave some in "defer" status) -makes things confusing... it's marked for DEFER but it will actually be DELETED.... ??

So attched is a diff file (if I'm doing this correctly) of the link that says "Mark all for delete", the javascript that does it, and the "delete those marked for defer" removed. As well as my revised version of moderation.php

Please let me know if there's another way I should be submitting these changes/suggestions.

item.title: Ticket #376 (Without Having Logged in - can see too much info!) updated
item.dc:creator: Jenn99
item.description:
Tested both versions of menu.php and admin-header.php - not sure which one was the one intended for the fix. Either way - both fix the problem I had.

Thanks! I think this bug can be marked as closed... (if I'm supposed to do it - I'm not sure where/how I would)
